name: Torch7
tagline: A numeric computing framework for LuaJIT.
body:
About Torch7
============

Torch7 is a numeric framework with wide support for machine learning
algorithm. It is easy to use and provides a very efficient
implementation, thanks to an easy and fast scripting language, LuaJIT
and an underlying C implementation.

If you have questions or need support, check out the [mailing list](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/torch7).

Installation
------------

The easiest way to install Torch is to follow 
[these instructions](https://github.com/torch/ezinstall). This simple script
will install LuaJIT, Luarocks and build Torch as well as a few important
packages for you.

Torch, and all its related packages, are now distributed as simple Luarocks packages. 
It only requires LuaJIT (>= 2.0) and Luarocks (>= 2.0.12):

    $ luajit --version
    uarocks 2.0.12
    $ luajit -v
    LuaJIT 2.0.2 -- Copyright (C) 2005-2013 Mike Pall. http://luajit.org/
    $ luarocks install torch
    ...

Other packages can be installed the same way, using Luarocks:

    $ luarocks install image
    $ luarocks list
    $ luarocks search --all

Packages
--------

Torch used to be distributed as a single repo, which provided a few default packages.
These packages, along with their documentation, are now each hosted on their own
Github repository. Here is the list of official Torch packages:

* [Torch7](https://github.com/torch/torch7) - [documentation](https://github.com/torch/torch7/blob/master/doc/README.md)
* [nn](https://github.com/torch/nn) - [documentation](https://github.com/torch/nn/blob/master/doc/README.md)
* [paths](https://github.com/torch/paths) - [documentation](https://github.com/torch/paths/blob/master/README.md)
* ...

More packages can be found on [Torch's Github portal](https://github.com/torch/).

Even more packages can be found using Luarocks:

    $ luarocks search --all

Credits
-------

Torch7 is developed at Idiap Research Institute, New York University 
and NEC Laboratories America.

At this time, Torch7 is maintained by Ronan Collobert (the dictator), 
Clement Farabet (the chemist) and Koray Kavukcuoglu (Dr Jekyll). 

We also use the great Qt Lua interface from Leon Bottou.

If you use Torch7 for your work, please cite the following paper:
R. Collobert, K. Kavukcuoglu and C. Farabet. Torch7: A Matlab-like 
Environment for Machine Learning. In BigLearn, NIPS Workshop, 2011.

License
-------

Torch7 is distributed under a BSD license. It runs on Linux, FreeBSD 
and MacOS X. With few tweaks, it should also run on Windows (we plan to 
support it soon).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
